BLD121.name: Survive and Thrive Freshman Seminar
BLD121.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD121.description: Academic skills and communication skills with an emphasis on scientific communication, professional behavior. History of the medical and the medical laboratory professions, and campus resources for a successful college experience.
BLD121.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores in the Biomedical Laboratory Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Biomedical Laboratory Science Coordinate Major or approval of department.

BLD204.name: Mechanisms of Disease
BLD204.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD204.description: Pathophysiological mechanisms of diseases. Selected applications to organ system pathology.

BLD213L.name: Clinical Laboratory Methods
BLD213L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD213L.description: Lab safety and standards of good laboratory practice including specimen handling and processing. Application of technologies and techniques to the performance of clinical diagnostic testing.
BLD213L.restrictions: Open to students in the Human Biology Major or in the Biomedical Laboratory Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Biomedical Laboratory Science Coordinate Major.

BLD214L.name: Biomedical Laboratory Research Techniques
BLD214L.description: Basic techniques, skills and safety in biomedical research. Ethical conduct of research and regulatory principles such as Good Laboratory Practice. Maintaining a research notebook for legal and intellectual property purposes. Offered second half of semester.
BLD214L.prerequisite: MTH 103 or MTH 103B or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or approval of department

BLD302.name: Clinical Chemistry
BLD302.description: Correlation of common medical laboratory testing and associated disease states, including comprehensive metabolic panel, lipid panel, thyroid panel, urinalysis and drugs of abuse screening.

BLD313.name: Quality in Clinical Laboratory Practice
BLD313.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD313.description: Concepts and principles of clinical laboratory analysis and the statistical evaluation of the data produced as related to quality.
BLD313.prerequisite: ((BLD 121 or concurrently) and BLD 213L) and ((STT 201 or STT 200 or STT 231) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)

BLD314L.name: Advanced Clinical Laboratory Methods
BLD314L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD314L.description: Diagnostics assays within the clinical laboratory including hematology, immunohematology, coagulation, urinalysis, and molecular diagnostics. Data interpretations and problem solving skills.
BLD314L.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Biomedical Laboratory Science Coordinate Major.

BLD324.name: Hematology and Hemostasis
BLD324.description: Physiology and biochemistry of normal hematologic and hemostatic systems. Principles of diagnostic assays to detect diseases affecting those systems.

BLD365.name: Medical Microbiology
BLD365.description: Laboratory diagnosis, disease and epidemiology of the most common bacterial, viral, fungal and parasitic pathogens and concepts in infectious disease control, prevention and treatment.

BLD365L.name: Medical Microbiology Laboratory
BLD365L.description: Practical experience in safely and accurately performing standard clinical microbiology tests to diagnose disease-causing microbes.

BLD366.name: Infectious Diseases of East Africa
BLD366.description: Biology and laboratory diagnosis of the most common infectious disease of the region. Health disparities and healthcare system organization.
BLD366.prerequisite: (BLD 213L) or BLD 214L or (CEM 162 and BS 171) or (LB 145 and LB 172L)

BLD402.name: Advanced Clinical Chemistry
BLD402.description: Differences in clinical laboratory testing results between normal and diseased populations. Metabolic and endocrine systems, acquired and inherited diseases, therapeutic drug monitoring and toxicology.
BLD402.prerequisite: (BLD 302 and BMB 401) or (BLD 302 and BMB 461 and BMB 462)

BLD424.name: Advanced Hematology and Hemostasis
BLD424.description: Etiology and pathogenesis of diseases of the hematologic and hemostatic systems including anemias, leukemias, and hemophilias. Diagnostic testing for such diseases.
BLD424.prerequisite: (BLD 324 and BMB 401) or (BLD 324 and BMB 461 and BMB 462)
BLD424.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program.

BLD424L.name: Advanced Hematology, Hemostasis and Urinalysis Laboratory
BLD424L.description: Specialized and advanced assays used in the diagnosis of diseases of the hematological, hemostatic, and urinary systems.
BLD424L.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program.

BLD430.name: Molecular Diagnostics
BLD430.description: Concepts and principles of molecular analysis applied to medical diagnostics and related applications.
BLD430.prerequisite: (BS 161 or LB 145 or BS 181H) and (BLD 204 and BLD 313)

BLD430L.name: Molecular Diagnostics Laboratory
BLD430L.description: Molecular technologies with emphasis on clinical and diagnostic applications.
BLD430L.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program or approval of department.

BLD434.name: Clinical Immunology
BLD434.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD434.description: Concepts of innate and adaptive immunity. Immunodeficiency and autoimmunity. Priniciples and applications of immunoassays in medical laboratories.

BLD435.name: Immunohematology
BLD435.description: Principles and practice of transfusion medicine including blood typing. Offered first ten weeks of semester.

BLD435L.name: Immunohematology Laboratory
BLD435L.description: Methods of blood typing and pre-transfusion testing.
BLD435L.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program.

BLD439.name: Histocompatibility and Immunogenetics
BLD439.description: The theory and principles of histocompatibility and immunogenetics as applied to transplant medicine.
BLD439.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Natural Science or in the Lyman Briggs College.

BLD443.name: Introduction to Laboratory Information Systems
BLD443.description: Purpose and function of information systems components used in medical laboratories. Practical applications of system selection, validation, maintenance, problem resolution and report generation.
BLD443.prerequisite: (CSE 201 or CSE 231) and (MTH 124 or MTH 132) and BLD 213L
BLD443.restrictions: Open to students in the Information Technology Minor.

BLD444.name: Laboratory Information Technology Practicum and Project Management
BLD444.description: Gain experience in using, maintaining and managing quality of a laboratory information system at a clinical or public health laboratory site. Project management principles and application.
BLD444.restrictions: Open to students in the Information Technology Minor. Approval of department.

BLD445.name: Medical Laboratory Management
BLD445.description: Management of clinical laboratories through adherence to laws and regulations, developing financial and budgeting tools, and assuring a competent workforce.
BLD445.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD446.name: Immunobiology of Neoplasia
BLD446.description: The biology of neoplastic cells (cancers, leukemias, lymphomas), the immune response to neoplasias, and immunotherapy of cancer.
BLD446.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Natural Science or in the Lyman Briggs College.

BLD447.name: Immunomodulation and Immunotherapy
BLD447.description: Current applications of Immunology understanding in the immunomodulation and immunotherapy of infectious disease, immunodeficiencies, autoimmune disease, and cancers.
BLD447.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Natural Science or in the Lyman Briggs College.

BLD452L.name: Immunodiagnostics Laboratory
BLD452L.description: Performance of immunopurifications, in vitro diagnostic assays and basic flow cytometry. Data analysis and quality control evaluation.
BLD452L.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Science Major or approval of department.

BLD456.name: Medical Laboratory Professionalism (W)
BLD456.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD456.description: Basic principles and concepts in education and professional behavior in clinical laboratories. Systematic approach to instructional design, delivery and evaluation. Principles of leadership.
BLD456.prerequisite: (BLD 121 and BLD 313) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
BLD456.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program.

BLD460.name: Advanced Molecular Diagnostics
BLD460.description: Common and specialized molecular diagnostic technologies applied to medical diagnostics and related applications.
BLD460.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the College of Natural Science.

BLD465.name: Advanced Medical Microbiology
BLD465.description: Advanced laboratory diagnosis, epidemiology, and prevention of infectious diseases using an anatomical system specimen approach to study a comprehensive set of human pathogens and microbiota.

BLD465L.name: Advanced Medical Microbiology Laboratory
BLD465L.description: Practical experience in safely and accurately performing standard clinical microbiology tests to process clinical specimens, identify pathogens and perform and interpret susceptibility testing.

BLD471L.name: Advanced Clinical Chemistry Laboratory
BLD471L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD471L.description: Application and integration of theory and technical skills in clinical chemistry and biochemistry.
BLD471L.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD473L.name: Advanced Clinical Hematology and Body Fluids Laboratory
BLD473L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD473L.description: Application and integration of theory and technical skills in hematology, hemostasis, and body fluid analysis.
BLD473L.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD475L.name: Advanced Clinical Immunology and Immunohematology Laboratory
BLD475L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD475L.description: Application and integration of theory and technical skills in immunology and immunohematology.
BLD475L.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD477L.name: Advanced Clinical Microbiology Laboratory
BLD477L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD477L.description: Application and integration of theory and technical skills in clinical microbiology and infectious disease.
BLD477L.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD479.name: Professional Behavior in Medical Laboratory Science
BLD479.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD479.description: Application of professional behavior principles to practical experiences in medical laboratory science.
BLD479.prerequisite: (BLD 445 and BLD 456) and ((BLD 471L or concurrently) and (BLD 473L or concurrently) and (BLD 475L or concurrently) and (BLD 477L or concurrently))
BLD479.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD480.name: Medical Laboratory Science Examinations I
BLD480.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD480.description: Medical laboratory science profession entry-level body of knowledge in clinical chemistry, hematology, hemostasis, body fluid analysis, immunology, immunohematology, and clinical microbiology. Integration of cognitive material with clinical laboratory test results.
BLD480.prerequisite: BLD 435L and BLD 402 and BLD 424L and MMG 465L
BLD480.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD481.name: Medical Laboratory Science Examinations II
BLD481.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD481.prerequisite: BLD 435L and BLD 402 and BLD 424L and BLD 480 and MMG 465L
BLD481.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program. Approval of department.

BLD495.name: Directed Study
BLD495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD495.description: Faculty directed study including assigned readings, reviews of appropriate scientific periodicals, research, and laboratory experience.
BLD495.restrictions: Open to students in the Biomedical Laboratory Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Biomedical Laboratory Science Coordinate Major.

BLD801.name: Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Seminar
BLD801.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD801.description: Current research topics in clinical laboratory sciences.

BLD805.name: Communication in the Sciences
BLD805.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
BLD805.description: Professional communication in clinical laboratory science, including article and proposal writing, thesis writing, posters, and presentations.

BLD811.name: Fundamentals of Scientific Research
BLD811.description: Best practices for the research enterprise. Ethical conduct of research. Critical evaluation of scientific literature.
BLD811.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program.

BLD815.name: Cell Biology in Health and Disease I
BLD815.description: Principles and theories of cell biology and biochemistry are presented with a focus on applications to clinical pathology.

BLD816.name: Cell Biology in Health and Disease II

BLD830.name: Concepts in Molecular Biology
BLD830.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD830.description: Techniques and theories of molecular biology, nucleic acid synthesis and isolation, enzymatic digestion and modification, electrophoresis, hybridization, amplification, library construction, and cloning.

BLD831.name: Clinical Application of Molecular Biology
BLD831.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD831.description: Molecular diagnostic principles. Diagnostic outcomes in traditional and non-traditional laboratory disciplines.

BLD832.name: Molecular Pathology Laboratory
BLD832.description: Equipment operation, DNA extraction and measurement, electrophoresis, hybridization and transfers, amplification and detection including techniques and automated sequencing. Clinical applications.

BLD835.name: Hemostasis, Thrombosis and Effective Resource Management
BLD835.description: Theories of coagulation, thrombosis and effective blood product management. Needs and particular stresses during an active bleeding crisis.

BLD836.name: Adverse Transfusion Outcomes: Detection, Monitoring and Prevention
BLD836.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD836.description: Adverse transfusion outcomes (ATO) covering cause, methods of detection, monitoring paradigms and prevention.

BLD837.name: Transfusion Service Operations and Management
BLD837.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD837.description: Management and operational practices needed to meet both the fiscal and regulatory oversight of a transfusion service.

BLD838.name: Clinical Context of Blood Product Management
BLD838.description: Effective blood product management in the context of high use, high demand clinical settings.

BLD839.name: Problems in Histocompatibility and Immunogenetics
BLD839.description: Application of transplant immunology to case studies and data analysis.

BLD842.name: Managing Biomedical Laboratory Operations
BLD842.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD842.description: Integration of the roles of legislative, regulatory, technological and economic factors that influence the practice and management of biomedical laboratory operations.
BLD842.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students or approval of department.

BLD844.name: Topics in Biomedical Laboratory Operations
BLD844.description: Current issues relevant to biomedical laboratory operations from an interdisciplinary perspective with an emphasis on efficient laboratory operations.
BLD844.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students or approval of department.

BLD846.name: Decision Processes for Biomedical Laboratory Operations
BLD846.description: Integrative case studies presented in a problem-based learning format. Strategies for decision-making in the operations of a biomedical laboratory. Cases integrate scientific principles, management principles and regulatory factors.
BLD846.restrictions: Open to master's students or lifelong graduate students or approval of department.

BLD850.name: Concepts in Immunodiagnostics
BLD850.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BLD850.description: Immunology principles and theory applied to diagnostic evaluation of the host immune response during health and disease.

BLD851.name: Clinical Application of Immunodiagnostic Principles
BLD851.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD851.description: Immunodiagnostic theories and principles applied to clinical assay development and method evaluation.

BLD852.name: Immunodiagnostics Laboratory
BLD852.description: Performance of immunopurifications, in vitro diagnostic assays and basic flow cytometry. Data analysis and quality control evaluation.

BLD853.name: Advanced Flow Cytometry
BLD853.description: Flow cytometry systems, software and reagents. Data analysis and experimental design of complex flow cytometric assays. Flow cytometry applications in medicine and research.
BLD853.prerequisite: BLD 850 and BLD 851 and (BLD 852 or concurrently) or approval of department

BLD854.name: Advanced Flow Cytometry Laboratory
BLD854.description: Flow cytometry and analyses exercises that emphasize controls, reagent titrations, assay validation, determination of assay sensitivity, and assay development using 6 to 8 fluorochromes.

BLD861.name: Emerging Infections, Emerging Technology
BLD861.description: Use of recent cases in infectious diseases to investigate the causes for disease emergence and the laboratory technologies used to identify the microbial causes, to describe epidemiology and to develop surveillance systems and prevention.

BLD862.name: Advances in Diagnostic Microbiology
BLD862.semester: Spring of odd years, Summer of even years
BLD862.description: Theoretical and applied clinical microbiology using MALDI-TOF, next generation sequencing, validation of new methods, and bioinformatics.

BLD870.name: Clinical Mass Spectrometry Theory
BLD870.description: The theory and principles of mass spectrometry. Principles of instrumentation, liquid and gas chromatography theory and data analysis as it applies to the clinical laboratory.

BLD871.name: Applied Clinical Mass Spectrometry
BLD871.description: Data interpretation and quality control in clinical mass spectrometry. Principles of sample preparation, platform selection, data analysis, and clinical applications as it applies to the clinical laboratory.

BLD872.name: Clinical Mass Spectrometry Laboratory
BLD872.description: Sample preparation, instrument operation, data interpretation, and instrument maintenance as it relates to the clinical practice.
BLD872.prerequisite: BLD 870 and BLD 871 or approval of department

BLD890.name: Selected Problems in Clinical Laboratory Science
BLD890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD890.description: Non-thesis research for Plan B master's students.
BLD890.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Natural Science or in the Biomedical Laboratory Diagnostics Program or in the Clinical Laboratory Sciences Major or in the Biomedical Laboratory Science Major.

BLD895.name: Projects in Biomedical Laboratory Operations
BLD895.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD895.description: Completion of a significant on-site project in cooperation with an industrial/clinical partner.
BLD895.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Biomedical Laboratory Operations major or approval of department.

BLD899.name: Master's Thesis Research
BLD899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BLD899.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Clinical Laboratory Sciences major.
